page.title: 08CHURCHES IN ROSSINGTON
page.content: There are many places of worship in Rossington. The oldest church is St Michael's, built in early Norman times. It is an Anglican church, as is St Luke's which was built in 1916 in New Rossington to serve the growing community around the coalmine. The other churches in the village are the Roman Catholic Christ the King, the Methodist, the Salvation Army and the New Life Christian Fellowship. Most of the churches have organisations attached to them such as Girl Guide, Brownie, Scout, Cub and women's groups. The churches hold United Services at intervals throughout the year. For the 1985 visit of the American evangelist, Dr Billy Graham, the churches organised coaches to Sheffield for Mission England.
